model_input:
[Task Description]
You will be given DIALOGUE CONTEXT and MEMORY.
Your job is to judge if MEMORY contains helpful past information for a language model, representing Unknown, to generate a proper next response based on DIALOGUE CONTEXT.

If the DIALOUGE CONTEXT does not require the model to utilize past information for response generation, say "N/A".
Say "Yes" if MEMORY contains such helpful information and say "No" if it dose not.
Provide a brief explanation for your judgement.

[Format Regulation]
Generate your output below OUTPUT using the following format:
Brief explanation: your explanation
Judgement: "Yes", "No", or "N/A"

[Task]
DIALOGUE CONTEXT:
Speaker A: I loaded up on repellent like you said and I also grabbed a few of those mosquito repellent bracelets, I figured why not!

[MEMORY]
1. Speaker A enjoys going on camping trips and hiking trails in parks.
2. Speaker A enjoys camping trips and looking for wild animals in the woods.
3. Speaker A enjoys camping and hiking as free activities.
4. Speaker B recently went on a long hike and enjoyed it
5. Speaker A has planned several camping trips for the summer and will be doing a part of the Appalachian Trail.
6. Speaker A is comfortable around animals in the woods but admits a bear would make them jumpy.
current_dialogue: Speaker A: I loaded up on repellent like you said and I also grabbed a few of those mosquito repellent bracelets, I figured why not!
memory_text:

speaker: Unknown
raw_prediction: Good to know you have some experience handling those situations. I think I'll stick to my urban adventures for now!
prediction:
Brief explanation: The memory contains helpful information regarding the past activities and future plans of Speaker A related to camping and hiking. This can provide more context to the kind of activities Speaker A is preparing for by purchasing repellent and bracelets.
Judgement: "Yes"
